WELCOME_DESC: Easily control and monitor your roller shutters, gates, garage doors, or any other device using the RTS protocol.
WELCOME_RAD_DESC: Configure the correct frequency for your devices
WELCOME_SYS_DESC: Language, access security, appearance and maintenance
WELCOME_FOOTER_NOTE: *Once a room, shade, or group has been created, this page will no longer be displayed.
GENERAL_UPNP_DESC: Broadcasts service announcements on the network to allow automatic device discovery by other equipment
SECURITY_SECURE_CONFIG_DESC: Restricts settings changes to secure connections only to prevent unauthorized modifications
CONNECTION_HIDDEN_SSID_DESC: Allows connection to a network that does not broadcast its name
CONNECTION_ROAMING_DESC: Always targets the nearest Wi-Fi access point
CONNECTION_ETHERNET_DESC: Uses Ethernet cable instead of Wi-Fi
CONNECTION_WIFI_FALLBACK_DESC: Switches to Wi-Fi if Ethernet fails
ADRESSIP_IP_REBOOT_INFO: Settings will only be applied after restarting the ESPSomfy RTS module
MQTT_ENABLE_DESC: Enables communication with your MQTT server (broker)
MQTT_PUB_DISCOVERY_DESC: Sends settings for automatic configuration in your system
MQTT_ROOT_TOPIC_PLH: Prefix used for all messages from this module
MQTT_DISCOVERY_TOPIC_PLH: Path used for automatic discovery by your system, e.g.: homeassistant
FLIP_COMMAND_DESC: Reverses the direction of the commands
EMPTY_ROOM_TITLE: No custom rooms have been created.
EMPTY_ROOM_DESC: Create rooms to organize your shades by area (Living room, Bedrooms, etc.).
EMPTY_SHADE_DESC: Add your first shade to start controlling them.
EMPTY_GROUP_TITLE: No groups have been created yet.
EMPTY_GROUP_DESC: Click the button below to add one.
EMPTY_REPEATER_TITLE: No remotes are currently being repeated.
EMPTY_REPEATER_DESC: Use the button below to capture and duplicate a signal.
ALL_DUPLICATE_REMOTES: All duplicate remote addresses are listed below.
DRAG_SORT: Drag each item to set the display order in the list.
NO_DEVICE: No devices are currently assigned to this room. You can add or move devices in the settings menu.
NAME: Name
ETH_SETTINGS_DESC: Confirm your Ethernet settings before validating.
ETH_SETTINGS_WARNING_DESC_1: Incorrect Ethernet settings may damage your ESP32. Please verify the settings below and ensure they match the manufacturer specifications.
ETH_SETTINGS_WARNING_DESC_2: I confirm these settings are correct for my hardware. I understand that incorrect settings can permanently damage the ESP32
SCANFREQ_DESC: Scan surrounding frequencies to identify and configure your radio devices.
SCANFREQ_SCAN_DESC: Frequency scanning has started. Press and hold any button on your remote control and ESPSomfy RTS will find the closest frequency to the remote.
SCANFREQ_RSSI_EXPLANATION: RSSI measures radio signal strength. The closer the number is to 0 (e.g., -40), the stronger the signal. Closer to -100 means poor reception or interference.
SCANFREQ_RSSI_WEAK_DESC: Weak Signal: Risk of command loss
SCANFREQ_RSSI_NOISE_DESC: Noise: Unstable signal or out of range.
ROLLING_CODE_DESC: Warning: an incorrect value may break communication with the shade
ROLLING_CODE_WARNING_DESC_1: If this shade is already paired with a motor, changing the rolling code will cause it to malfunction. Rolling codes are tied to the remote address and the Somfy motor expects them to be sequential.
ROLLING_CODE_WARNING_DESC_2: If you hesitate even slightly, do not press the red button. Green represents safety — press it, wipe the sweat from your forehead, and follow the normal pairing process.
PAIR_GARAGE_DESC: Follow the steps to link your garage door to ESPSomfy-RTS
PAIR_GARAGE_STEP_1: Open the garage door motor memory according to the motor instructions.
PAIR_GARAGE_STEP_2: Once the memory is open, press the Prog button below.
PAIR_GARAGE_STEP_3: For single-button control, ESPSomfy RTS will send a toggle command, but for 3-button control, it will send a Prog command.
PAIR_SHADE_DESC: Follow the steps to link your shade to ESPSomfy-RTS
PAIR_SHADE_STEP_1: Open the shade memory using an existing remote by pressing the Prog button on the back until the shade performs a back-and-forth movement.
PAIR_SHADE_STEP_2: After the shade performs the movement, press the Prog button below.
PAIR_SHADE_STEP_3: The shade should perform another back-and-forth movement indicating it is paired. NOTE: on some motors, you may need to hold the Prog button.
PAIR_SHADE_STEP_4: If the shade performs the movement, you can press the "Shade paired" button.
PAIR_SHADE_STEP_5: If the shade does not perform the movement, try pressing the Prog button again.
UNPAIR_SHADE_DESC_1: Follow the instructions below to unpair this shade from a Somfy motor.
UNPAIR_SHADE_STEP_1: Open the shade motor memory using an existing remote control.
UNPAIR_SHADE_STEP_2: Press the PROG button on the back of the remote control until the shade performs a back-and-forth movement.
UNPAIR_SHADE_STEP_3: After the shade performs a back-and-forth movement, press the PROG button below.
UNPAIR_SHADE_STEP_4: The shade should perform another back-and-forth movement, indicating it has been unpaired.
UNPAIR_SHADE_STEP_5: If the shade performs a back-and-forth movement, you can press the “Shade Unpaired” button.
UNPAIR_SHADE_STEP_6: If the shade does not perform a back-and-forth movement, press the PROG button again until it reacts.
LINK_REMOTE_DESC: Link your remote control to the shade
LINK_REMOTE_DESC_1: Press any button on the remote control to link it to this shade.
LINK_REMOTE_DESC_2: This will not modify the remote control pairing, and this screen will close once the remote is detected.
REPEAT_REMOTE_DESC_1: Press any button on the remote control to repeat its signals.
REPEAT_REMOTE_DESC_2: Once assigned, ESPSomfy RTS will act as a repeater and repeat all signals from the identified remote controls.
REPEAT_REMOTE_DESC_3: Assign a repeater only when ESPSomfy RTS reliably receives a physical remote control but the motor does not.
REPEAT_REMOTE_DESC_4: Repeating unnecessary radio signals will degrade radio performance, and never assign the same repeater to more than one ESPSomfy RTS device. You would create an insidious echo chamber.
REPEAT_REMOTE_DESC_5: Once a signal is detected from the remote control, this window will close and the remote control signals will be repeated.
LINK_GROUP_DESC: Wizard to add a shade to the group
LINK_GROUP_STEP1_DESC_1: This wizard will guide you through the steps required to add shades to a group. Follow all instructions at each step until the shade is added to the group.
LINK_GROUP_STEP1_DESC_2: During this process, the shade must perform exactly two jogs. The first indicates that the motor memory has been activated, and the second adds the group to the motor memory.
LINK_GROUP_STEP1_DESC_3: Each shade must be paired individually to the group. When you are ready to start pairing your shade to the group, press the NEXT button.
LINK_GROUP_STEP2_DESC_1: Choose a shade that you want to include in this group. Once you have selected the shade to include, press the NEXT button.
LINK_GROUP_STEP2_DESC_2: Only shades that have not already been included in this group are available in the dropdown list. Each shade can be included in multiple groups.
LINK_GROUP_STEP3_DESC_1: Now that you have chosen a shade to pair, open the shade memory by pressing the OPEN MEMORY button. The shade must perform a jog to indicate that the memory has been opened.
LINK_GROUP_STEP3_DESC_2: The motor must perform only one jog. If it performs multiple jogs, you have closed the motor memory again. Once the command is sent to the motor, you will be asked to confirm whether the motor reacted correctly.
LINK_GROUP_STEP3_DESC_3: If so, press YES. Otherwise, press NO and click the OPEN MEMORY button again.
LINK_GROUP_STEP4_DESC_1: Now that the motor memory is open, you must send the pairing command for the group.
LINK_GROUP_STEP4_DESC_2: To do this, press the PAIR TO GROUP button below. Once the motor performs the jog, the process will be complete.
LINK_GROUP_MEMORY_READY_FOR_GROUP: Once the shade has performed a back-and-forth movement, the motor memory will be ready to add the shade to the group.
LINK_GROUP_LINK_DONE: Once the shade has performed a back-and-forth movement, it will be added to the group and the process will be completed.
UNLINK_GROUP_DESC: Wizard to remove a shade from the group
UNLINK_GROUP_STEP1_DESC_1: This wizard will guide you through the steps required to remove a shade from a group. Follow all instructions at each step until the shade is removed from the group.
UNLINK_GROUP_STEP1_DESC_2: During this process, the shade must perform exactly two back-and-forth movements. The first indicates that the motor memory is open and the second that the group is removed from the motor memory.
UNLINK_GROUP_STEP1_DESC_3: Each shade must be removed from the group individually. When you are ready to start unlinking the shade from the group, press the NEXT button to begin.
UNLINK_GROUP_STEP2_DESC_1: You must first open the shade memory by pressing the OPEN MEMORY button. The shade should perform a back-and-forth movement to indicate that the memory is open.
UNLINK_GROUP_STEP2_DESC_2: The motor must perform only one back-and-forth movement. If it performs more than one, it means the motor memory has been closed. Once the movement is completed, press the NEXT button to continue.
UNLINK_GROUP_STEP3_DESC_1: Now that the motor memory is open, you must send the command to unlink the shade from the group.
UNLINK_GROUP_STEP3_DESC_2: To do this, press the UNPAIR FROM GROUP button below. Once the motor performs a back-and-forth movement, the process will be completed.
UNLINK_GROUP_METHOD_1: If you have difficulty making the motor respond at this step, you can try opening the memory using a remote control. This is usually done by selecting the channel and holding the PROG button.
UNLINK_GROUP_METHOD_2: If you opened the memory using this alternative method, press the NO button to close this message, then press the NEXT button to skip this step.
RESTORE_DESC: Restore a previous backup to recover your settings and devices.
RESTORE_SELECT_FILE: Select a backup file to restore along with the options to restore, then click the "Upload file" button.
RESTORE_NETWORK_WARNING: Restoring network settings from a different board than the original will ignore Ethernet chip settings. Security, MQTT, and WiFi information will not be restored because backup files do not contain passwords.
SAVESECURITY_PIN_WARNING: Please keep your PIN code in a safe place and do not forget it. The only way to recover a lost PIN code is to fully reload the initialization firmware, which will erase your entire configuration.
SAVESECURITY_PIN_CONFIRM: Have you saved your PIN code in a secure location?
SAVESECURITY_PASSWORD_WARNING: Please keep your password in a safe place and do not forget it. The only way to recover a lost password is to fully reload the initialization firmware, which will erase your entire configuration.
SAVESECURITY_PASSWORD_CONFIRM: Have you saved your username and password in a secure location?
GIT_RELEASE_DESC: Please wait while the version %1 is being downloaded and installed
GIT_RELEASE_WAIT_WARNING: Please wait while the files are being downloaded and installed.
GIT_RELEASE_WAIT_WARNING_1: Once the application update process has started, it can no longer be cancelled, otherwise the downloaded files may be corrupted.
UPDATE_GIT_DESC: The installation will be done directly from Github.
UPDATE_GIT_RELEASE_DESC: You have selected a pre-released beta version that has not been fully tested or published for general use.
UPDATE_GIT_NO_AUTO_BACKUP: This browser does not support automatic backups. It is strongly recommended to backup your configuration using the backup button before continuing.
UPDATE_GIT_BACKUP_DOWNLOAD_UP: A backup of your configuration will be downloaded to your browser. If the update fails, restore this file using the restore button after the installation process.
NO_AUTO_BACKUP: This browser does not support automatic backups. It is strongly recommended to back up your configuration using the backup button before proceeding.
UPDATE_FIRMWARE_DESC: Upload the Firmware binary file to update the system.
UPDATE_FIRMWARE_UPLOAD_FIRMWARE_DESC: Select a binary file %1 containing the device firmware, then click the « Upload File » button.
UPDATE_FIRMWARE_BACKUP_DOWNLOAD_FIRMWARE: A backup of your configuration will be downloaded to your browser. If the firmware update fails, restore this file using the restore button after finishing the initialization process.
UPDATE_LITTLEFS_DESC: Upload the LittleFS binary file to update system resources.
UPDATE_LITTLEFS_select: Select a binary file %1 containing the LittleFS application data, then click the "Upload File" button.
UPDATE_LITTLEFS_BACKUP_DOWNLOAD: A backup of your configuration will be downloaded to your browser. If the application update fails, restore it using the restore button.
PROMPT_RESTART_DEVICE: Are you sure you want to restart the device?
PROMPT_DELETE_ROOM: Are you sure you want to delete this room?
PROMPT_DELETE_SHADE: Are you sure you want to delete this shade?
PROMPT_DELETE_GROUP: Are you sure you want to delete this group?
PROMPT_UNLINK_REPEATER: Are you sure you want to stop repeating frames from this address?
PROMPT_UNLINK_REMOTE: Are you sure you want to unlink this remote from the shade?
PROMPT_SHADE_MOVE_CONFIRM: Did the shade perform a back-and-forth movement? If yes, press the YES button. Otherwise, press the NO button and try again.
PROMPT_SHADE_MOVE_DONE: Once the shade has performed the back-and-forth movement, it will be removed from the group and the process will be completed.
PROMPT_SHADE_OPEN_MEMORY_CONFIRM: Did the shade perform a back-and-forth movement? If yes, press the YES button. Otherwise, press the NO button and try again.
PROMPT_SHADE_GROUP_LINK_CONFIRM: Did the shade perform a back-and-forth movement? If yes, press the YES button and the shade will be linked to the group. Otherwise, press the NO button and try again.
PROMPT_DELETE_ROOM_WARNING: If this room was previously assigned to motors or groups, they will be automatically reassigned to the "Home" room.
PROMPT_DELETE_SHADE_WARNING: If this shade was previously paired with a motor, you must first unpair it from the motor and remove it from all groups. Otherwise, its address will remain stored in the motor memory.
PROMPT_DELETE_SHADE_CONFIRM: Press YES to delete {SHADE_NAME}, or NO to cancel this operation.
PROMPT_DELETE_GROUP_CONFIRM: Press YES to delete the group {GROUP_NAME}, or NO to cancel this operation.
PROMPT_REBOOT_CONFIRM: Are you sure you want to reboot the device?
ERR_SOCKET_CONNECT: Unable to connect to the server
ERR_INVALID_HOSTNAME: You must supply a valid Host Name.
ERR_HOSTNAME_CHARS: The host name must only include numbers, letters, or dash.
ERR_HOSTNAME_LENGTH: The maximum Host Name length is 32 characters.
ERR_NTP_LENGTH: The maximum NTP Server length is 64 characters.
ERR_PIN_INVALID_DESC: The PIN code must contain exactly 4 alphanumeric characters. Please enter a complete code.
ERR_USERNAME_MISSING_DESC: You must provide a username for password security.
ERR_USERNAME_INVALID_DESC: The maximum length of the username is 32 characters.
ERR_PASSWORD_MISSING_DESC: You must provide a password for password security.
ERR_PASSWORD_INVALID_DESC: The maximum length of the password is 32 characters.
ERR_PASSWORD_CONFIRM_MISSING_DESC: You must re-enter the password in the "Re-enter password" field.
ERR_PASSWORD_MISMATCH_DESC: Please re-enter the password exactly as entered in the confirmation field.
ERR_STATIC_IP_REQUIRED: You must provide a valid IP address for the static IP.
ERR_STATIC_IP_INVALID: Invalid static IP address. Expected format is XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX.
ERR_NETMASK_REQUIRED: You must provide a valid IP address for the subnet mask.
ERR_NETMASK_INVALID: Invalid subnet mask IP address. Expected format is XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX.
ERR_GATEWAY_REQUIRED: You must provide a valid IP address for the gateway.
ERR_GATEWAY_INVALID: Invalid gateway IP address. Expected format is XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX.
ERR_DNS1_INVALID: Invalid DNS server 1 IP address. Expected format is XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX.
ERR_DNS2_INVALID: Invalid DNS server 2 IP address. Expected format is XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX.
ERR_WIFI_SSID_MAX_LENGTH_64: The maximum length of the SSID is 64 characters.
ERR_WIFI_PASSPHRASE_MAX_LENGTH_64: The maximum length of the passphrase is 64 characters.
ERR_RADIO_TYPE_REQUIRED: You must select a radio type.
ERR_RADIO_PINS_REQUIRED: You must define all the pins for the radio.
ERR_GPIO_PIN_DUPLICATED: The %1 pin is duplicated by the %2.  All pin definitions must be unique
ERR_ROOM_NAME_INVALID: You must provide a name for the room between 1 and 20 characters.
ERR_REMOTE_ADDRESS_INVALID: The remote address must be a number between 1 and 16777215. This number must be unique for all shades.
ERR_SHADE_NAME_INVALID: You must provide a name for the shade between 1 and 20 characters.
ERR_UP_TIME_INVALID: The up time must be a value between 0 and 4294967295 milliseconds. It corresponds to the time it takes for the shade to move from fully closed to fully open.
ERR_DOWN_TIME_INVALID: The down time must be a value between 0 and 4294967295 milliseconds. It corresponds to the time it takes for the shade to move from fully open to fully closed.
ERR_GPIO_UP_DOWN_NOT_UNIQUE: For GPIO controlled motors the up and down GPIO selections must be unique.
ERR_GPIO_UP_DOWN_MY_NOT_UNIQUE: For GPIO controlled motors the up and down and my GPIO selections must be unique.
ERR_ROOM_ID_REQUIRED: A valid room id was not supplied.
ERR_SHADE_ID_REQUIRED: A valid shade id was not supplied.
ERR_SHADE_IN_GROUP: You cannot delete this shade because it is part of a group.
ERR_GROUP_NOT_EMPTY: You may not delete this group until all shades have been removed from it.
ERR_INVALID_GROUP_ID: A valid group ID was not provided
ERR_NO_SHADE_AVAILABLE_FOR_GROUP: There are no available shades to pair to this group.
ERR_SHADE_NOT_FOUND_IN_GROUP: The specified shade could not be found in this group.
ERR_MQTT_HOSTNAME_REQUIRED: You must supply a host name to connect to MQTT.
ERR_HOSTNAME_MAX_LENGTH_64: The maximum length of the host name is 64 characters.
ERR_MQTT_PORT_HINT: Likely ports are 1183, 8883 for MQTT/S or 80,443 for HTTP/S
ERR_USERNAME_MAX_LENGTH_32: The maximum length of the username is 32 characters.
ERR_PASSWORD_MAX_LENGTH_32: The maximum length of the password is 32 characters.
ERR_ROOT_TOPIC_MAX_LENGTH_64: The maximum length of the root topic is 64 characters.
ERR_NO_FILE_LITTLEFS_SELECTED: You must select a littleFS binary file to proceed.
ERR_INVALID_FILE_LITTLEFS: This file is not a valid littleFS binary file.
ERR_NO_FILE_FIRMWARE_SELECTED: You must select a valid firmware binary file to proceed.
ERR_INVALID_FILE_FIRMWARE: This file is not a valid firmware binary file.
ERR_NO_FILE_BACKUP_SELECTED: You must select a valid backup file to proceed.
ERR_BACKUP_TOO_LARGE: This file is %s bytes in length.  This file is too large to be a valid backup file.
ERR_INVALID_FILE_BACKUP: This file is not a valid backup file
ERR_NO_RESTORE_OPTION: No restore options have been selected
ERR_PIN_TRANSCEIVER: Pin setting in use for Transceiver. Output pins cannot be re-used.
ERR_PIN_ETHERNET: Pin setting in use for Ethernet Adapter. Output pins cannot be re-used.
ERR_PIN_MOTOR: Pin setting in use on another motor. Output pins cannot be re-used.
ERR_GIT_FILE_SIZE: Git Update: Invalid file size given.
ERR_GIT_ACTIVATE: Git Update: Could not activate firmware.
ERR_GIT_PARTITION: Git Update: Partition could not be found.
